topicSections.title: Convenience initializers for working with text views

abstract.text: Perform calculations across multiple lines

inlineContent.text: Offers many features for working with lines (presumably in a text view) including:
Parsing and evaluating lines, and their dependencies (via line references and variable declarations)
Notifying observers when dependent lines are evaluated
states. You can get a ticket (
) and jump back or forward to any states

abstract.text: Insert a line below another line at a given index
Completes a batch change that was begun with a call to beginChanges(), performing evaluation and dependency updating as required
Are all indexes in this set present in the line collection?
A total of all lines, calculated synchronously
Insert a new line with the specified expression at the given line index
A string that’s used as a “ticket” for traversing
states
Overrides existing lines formatting/line-references, etc
“previous line”, “line above”, or “prev” in English
Returns a tokenIndexPath for a given token
Returns a variableList for a line at a given index
Resets the line reference symbol for a line at the given index
Evaluates requested lines synchronously, and their dependencies asychronously (thus the callback).
Set the content for a line subsheet in this line collection
like city = Sydney
Sets the alignment for a particular line in the line collection
Generate a variable that represents a collection of the results in this line collection
Create a reference symbol for a line

Revert to a previous state of the line collection

objects

A time dependent line is a line whose result depends on the current time (like where the expression is “now + 10 minutes”)
Rename keys with values in parsed expressions
Text that includes multiple lines separated by newline characters

Always 0
Similar to the NotificationCentre observer API

This invalidates all tickets

) for a set of lines in the collection (with some options)
